ETYMOLOGY: Derived from the noun 'cheer,' which originated from Old French 'chere' (face, countenance), ultimately from Late Latin 'cara' (face). The meaning shifted to 'mood/spirit' (14th century) and then to 'shout of encouragement/joy' (16th century). The interjection usages (toast, thanks, goodbye) are modern (20th century).
